body_html:
Are you feeding example by example?
…
On Sat, Oct 21, 2017, 7:17 PM Patrick Nguyen ***@***.***> wrote: Cc @mrry I'm surprised that the data interface would be slow. Can you publish how you treated that? On Sat, Oct 21, 2017, 7:15 PM littleDing ***@***.***> wrote: > The build-in interfaces(both tf.data and csv op) are to slow for large > scale data. > Early tests (at about 2016-11 with tensorflow 1.0 or earlier version) > shows that use cython + pandas + feeddict to load csv data would be 2~5x > speed up than the build-in ops. > > A problem using pandas + feeddict is that it blocks with the python GIL > and python codes is still slow, thus the speed up would scale when number > of threads is over 5. > > So I'm wondering if it is possible to translate the codes into pure cpp > so that it could benefit from the tf.queue ops. > > — > You are receiving this because you were assigned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#13883 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbQEklezj6kjSp60LRQ7WTEDwWywjks5suqVDgaJpZM4QBpDI> > . >
body_text:
Are you feeding example by example?
…
On Sat, Oct 21, 2017, 7:17 PM Patrick Nguyen ***@***.***> wrote:
 Cc @mrry

 I'm surprised that the data interface would be slow. Can you publish how
 you treated that?

 On Sat, Oct 21, 2017, 7:15 PM littleDing ***@***.***> wrote:

> The build-in interfaces(both tf.data and csv op) are to slow for large
> scale data.
> Early tests (at about 2016-11 with tensorflow 1.0 or earlier version)
> shows that use cython + pandas + feeddict to load csv data would be 2~5x
> speed up than the build-in ops.
>
> A problem using pandas + feeddict is that it blocks with the python GIL
> and python codes is still slow, thus the speed up would scale when number
> of threads is over 5.
>
> So I'm wondering if it is possible to translate the codes into pure cpp
> so that it could benefit from the tf.queue ops.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were assigned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <#13883 (comment)>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbQEklezj6kjSp60LRQ7WTEDwWywjks5suqVDgaJpZM4QBpDI>
> .
>
body:
Are you feeding example by example?

On Sat, Oct 21, 2017, 7:17 PM Patrick Nguyen <drpng@google.com> wrote:

> Cc @mrry
>
> I'm surprised that the data interface would be slow. Can you publish how
> you treated that?
>
> On Sat, Oct 21, 2017, 7:15 PM littleDing <notifications@github.com> wrote:
>
>> The build-in interfaces(both tf.data and csv op) are to slow for large
>> scale data.
>> Early tests (at about 2016-11 with tensorflow 1.0 or earlier version)
>> shows that use cython + pandas + feeddict to load csv data would be 2~5x
>> speed up than the build-in ops.
>>
>> A problem using pandas + feeddict is that it blocks with the python GIL
>> and python codes is still slow, thus the speed up would scale when number
>> of threads is over 5.
>>
>> So I'm wondering if it is possible to translate the codes into pure cpp
>> so that it could benefit from the tf.queue ops.
>>
>> —
>> You are receiving this because you were assigned.
>> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
>> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/13883#issuecomment-338445604>,
>> or mute the thread
>> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbQEklezj6kjSp60LRQ7WTEDwWywjks5suqVDgaJpZM4QBpDI>
>> .
>>
>
